test_description: Verify technician can resolve a job and capture signature while offline, with automatic sync upon reconnection
business_risk: Critical - Data loss leads to billing disputes and lost service history
preconditions: Technician logged in; Job status 'Work In Progress'; Local database seeded; Network disconnected
test_steps: 1. Disable network connectivity; 2. Open assigned job details; 3. Enter completion notes and parts used; 4. Capture customer signature; 5. Tap 'Mark as Resolved'; 6. Verify UI shows 'Pending Sync' state; 7. Restore network connectivity; 8. Verify data sync to backend
expected_result: Local state updates immediately; Request queues in WatermelonDB; Sync triggers automatically on reconnect; Backend status updates to 'Resolved'; Signature blob uploads to Azure Storage
test_data_needs: Test Technician Account; Active Service Request ID; Sample Signature Image Blob
tools_required: Detox (Mobile Automation); Network Link Conditioner; Mock Server
dependencies: Mobile Sync Service; Backend Service Request API; Azure Blob Storage
environment_requirements: Physical Device or Emulator with Network Throttling capability
success_criteria: Zero data loss; Sync completes <30s after reconnect; UI reflects correct state
failure_impact: High - Technician cannot complete work in field; Data inconsistency
data_setup_complexity: High - Requires specific job state and network manipulation
cleanup_requirements: Reset Job Status; Clear Local DB
performance_expectations: Local save <200ms; Sync background process <15% battery impact

test_description: Verify Service Request routing logic correctly matches User Location to Service Center Polygon
business_risk: High - Service requests assigned to wrong center causes delays and SLA breaches
preconditions: Service Centers defined with PostGIS Polygons; User address geocoded
test_steps: 1. Create Service Center A with Polygon A; 2. Create Service Center B with Polygon B; 3. Submit Service Request with lat/long inside Polygon A; 4. Submit Service Request with lat/long inside Polygon B; 5. Submit Service Request outside both polygons
expected_result: Request 1 assigns to Center A; Request 2 assigns to Center B; Request 3 triggers 'No Coverage' fallback flow
tools_required: Jest; Supertest; PostgreSQL Test Container with PostGIS
